title.narrative: Mapping to support New Liberty Case FMO

description.narrative: Supported by Inclusive Development International (IDI), Rights and Rice Foundation (RFF) (Liberia) and the NGO Coalition of Liberiahave a history with the affected communities, where they have tried to have a dialogue with the mining company. IDI supported RRF to write a letter to the company, which outlined the human rights violations and requested a meeting with affected communities but the company was dismissive. The affected communities urged RFF and the NGO Coalition, during their field mission, tohelp them file a complaint to the FMO’s ICM as a next step in their long struggle of seeking redress for the harms caused by this mine. The resettled communities have lost their agricultural livelihoods. Data collected during the field mission will demonstrate how this has impactedwomen. But in general we know, that women are more severely impacted when it comes to losing agricultural land. Throughout the complaint process, we will ensure that the needs addressed by women are taken. Building on experience by IDI, we will have professional maps and analysis done by an external party, to build a concrete evidence base to support communities' claims. Similar to examples from IDI’s Guinea cases, where maps have been used to great effect. In one of the cases, IDI was able to use maps to counter the company's lies about the state of a village prior to resettlement. In the other case, IDI used maps to show the expansion of the mine and resulting land loss and water pollution. The information has been presented in a variety of advocacy settings, including with lenders, investors and downstream buyers.

participating-org.narrative: IDI was founded in 2012 in order to bring new resources and strategies to support those fighting on the front lines for just and inclusive development. IDIs strategy revolves around the mining of data to unravel and expose investment and supply chains behind harmful projects. Using the financial sector#s own technology and tools, our researchers follow the money, identify pressure points and place critical information in the hands of the people whose future depends on it. IDI works with communities over the long haul to achieve justice by leveraging pressure points through sustained, multi-pronged and evidence-based advocacy strategies. IDI uses the evidence from casework and research on financial flows and supply chains in global policy battlegrounds tocampaign for stronger humanrights regulation and accountability of corporations, financial institutions and development agencies.
